p:
Influenza vaccines have a good safety record, but their effectiveness varies widely. One important issue is the potential for mismatch between the vaccine-selected strain and circulating strain, which is not uncommon. Between 2002 and 2015, five virus mismatches to the influenza vaccine had occurred.
20 The potential effect of these mismatches can be seen in the increase in outpatient visits seen in those years ( Figure 3).
